senses.de: To withdraw or remove something from a place.
senses.ex: I had to pull out a splinter from my finger.
cl: pull out of a parking space

Tips.title: Withdrawing an object
Tips.description: Use 'pull out' when removing something physical from somewhere.
Tips.example: He pulled out his wallet to pay for the meal.

Tips.title: Withdrawing from an agreement
Tips.description: Use 'pull out' to describe withdrawing from a commitment or agreement.
Tips.example: The company decided to pull out of the merger deal.

senses.de: (Of a vehicle) to move away from the side of the road or a parking space and into the flow of traffic.
senses.ex: A car pulled out in front of me without warning.

Tips.title: Entering traffic
Tips.description: Use 'pull out' to describe a vehicle merging into the flow of traffic.
Tips.example: She slowly pulled out of the parking lot and into the street.

extract.wordDefinition: 'Extract' suggests a more deliberate and often more difficult removal, while 'pull out' is more general.

remove.wordDefinition: 'Remove' is a more general term for taking something away, while 'pull out' specifically implies a pulling motion.

withdraw.wordDefinition: 'Withdraw' can be used in more abstract contexts (like withdrawing money or an offer), while 'pull out' usually refers to a physical action.
